title: Registered Nurse Interview

Interview Descriptions: You get a phone call from a hiring recruiter, if they like you and you qualify then you get an interview which is usually with a few members of the team. They ask basic questions such as tell me about yourself, what are your strengths and weaknesses, and why you chose inova.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a team you dealt with a difficult patient or coworker and how you overcame it

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Inova (McLean, VA) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: I first interviewed with a recruiter, who referred me to a more specific recruiter. After that, I interviewed with the hiring manager in the specific medical office I was applying to. Finally, I went into the medical office to shadow the others in the position I applied for. The shadowing process took about an hour. They then got back to me by the end of the week.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in healthcare?

title: Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Inova (Fairfax, VA) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: Easy! Recruiters great to work with. Everyone gave glowing reviews of this workplace. Seems like a very supportive place to start working. Would recommend to a friend. Prepare for the interview with reflective questions, they care about who you are and not just what is one your resume - though they do read that too!
Interview Questions: How have you grown since starting school?

title: Patient Financial Services Representative Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Inova (Falls Church, VA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview team was delightful, and the job description exactly matched my qualifications. It was a dream come true. Unfortunately there was a screening call that should have happened before the video interview. Hiring managers had reviewed my qualifications, and pushed me forward in the process. During the screening interview that followed, I learned of a stumbling block. When they say on the cover page that every employee must be vaccinated, yes. They do even mean remote customer service roles.
Interview Questions: Give an example of excellent customer service you have provided in the past.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Inova
Interview Descriptions: Interview was first on the phone with hiring managers and then in person with larger team. Quick process overall but long day of interviewing. 1 month total from application to offer.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to join inova

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Inova (Fairfax, VA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online via website. Made it easier to already have a connection via someone in the department or from working in another area. Came in for interview which consisted of primary manager and department manager. Process easy and fair.
Interview Questions: Why work for this department?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Inova
Interview Descriptions: The new grad recruiter emailed me a week or two after I submitted my application. We set up a meeting time to discuss availabilities. If you want a specialty, apply 6+ months out from start date, as July spots were already filled when I applied in early February. The recruiter was a bit pushy on which units to apply to. After this initial meeting, you have an interview with the unit manager. Some units have virtual interviews while others ask for you to come in person. The interview was straightforward, asked why I wanted to work on that unit, and questions about my experiences. I think most units try to arrange a shadow day before sending you an offer letter.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this unit?

title: Registered Respiratory Therapist (RRT) Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Inova (Falls Church, VA) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Applied via INOVA website received an email by the clinical manager for an in person interview after sending in my CV had an in person interview with in a week of applying
Interview Questions: asked me a couple of behavioral questions and how that impacted my decisions

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Inova (Fairfax, VA) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: I've had 4 interviews with different people for different jobs at INOVA over the past 3 months. Most of them were pleasant and not too challenging, your standard run through of jobs, why I left, what I did in between if it wasn't nursing...not a single behavioral example requested; maybe that's at the next step (which I never made it to). To back up for a minute, I am an RN returning to the field after time off for some growth and good stuff (relocation, working in retail for a bit) and some difficult reasons (dad's cancer, my disillusionment with healthcare...,). My resume shows all my nursing jobs and some of the jobs I held when I wasn't working as a nurse. Well, one INOVA interviewer clearly was suspicious. She asked me in 3 different ways if I had been incarcerated, and scoffed at my 3rd answer. So I just said something like, "I was not in jail. I have never been in jail or even accused of a crime. And don't you do background checks?" After a pause, she continued with the interrogation about employment gaps (nothing about my jobs as a nurse, that wasn't of interest apparently) and then was wrapping it up. I decided to save us time, and said, "So, it seems you're needing someone with more recent experience as an RN." Indeed she was. In fact, she could have saved us both an hour if she had noted that at the start of the interview, since my resume is reverse chronological and my last nursing job ended in 2019.
Interview Questions: "We have a policy that employees with any convictions disclose them in the hiring process. Will it be a problem to comply with this?"

title: Clinical Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Inova
Interview Descriptions: sure easy! They call to set up an in person interview, and you show up on your desired date and time. The hospital is big but they give you great instructions.

title: Registered Nurse Interview

title: Unit Secretary Interview

Interview Descriptions: quick interview, not personable, would not choose to work there. title: Radiologic Technologist Interview

title: Clinical Technician Interview

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Inova

Tell us about a time you disagreed with a coworker and how you handled it.

title: Talent Acquisition Sourcer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Inova (Falls Church, VA) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online and had one interview on Zoom with the hm. She advised me of her hard deadline of when she will get back to me with a decision, but I still haven't heard anything back. My status says "Under Consideration" a month after she said she would get back to me.

If the hiring decision is this slow, it makes me wonder if the department is a hot mess and disorganized.  If you can't decide between 4-5 people, I question your judgment skills. 

Red flag!!!
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Senior Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Inova in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions:
I didn't actually get to the interview process but had a negative experience trying to schedule an interview. 
I was contacted by a senior recruiter to set up a 15 minute phone screen, using their scheduly account. I received an email confirmation of the time and day of received a text message confirming the time I selected. The recruiter called and left me a mean voicemail 30 minutes before our scheduled call saying that they waited for me but didn't have time to wait around and that I could call them later in the day. When I got in touch with the recruiter at our confirmed scheduled time, they notified me that my original scheduled screen time no longer worked for them and they had rescheduled my screen a half hour earlier--but never notified me. I communicated this to them and their answer was "well it's on my calendar, so it must be your error". 
Annoyed, but still interested in the position, I agreed to call back at the new time we agreed upon. However, I called the recruiter twice at the new time with no answer and their voicemail box full so I could not leave a message. The recruiter never called me back, but instead sent an email over the weekend apologizing for the confusion and asked to reschedule. I emailed and gave a couple times I was available for rescheduling and never heard back from the recruiter. 
It's highly unprofessional and if this is how they treat job applicants, I can't imagine how they treat actual employees.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Inova (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
Filled out an online form . I received an email from a recruiter from their hr  department and an interview was set up immediately. The interview which would be the first I assume.  It was a  indept 40 minute quiz of various diagnosis that you may end up treating. R cva versus L cva , Asia scale, ranchos Los amigos..ect  Verbalizing making goals on the spot ect , it felt like a verbal board exam than an interview to be honest. It did not come off as a warm nor friendly enviorment to grow and learn. There was no tour of the facility nor tour of treatment gyms . They seemed very clear on what they wanted however I did not feel comfortable. 

My work ethic could have been ask via my references that were also never asked of. Rather then getting to know me felt like I was going to be a cog in the wheel . I did not feel like it was a good fit for me.  However it may be for someone else .  

The work life culture as well as holidays were explained pretty fast . They will always be mentors around however they want you to be independent.  Of course with hospital systems holidays are few . When you worked on weekends you take a day off . It didnt seem like you had a designation of diagnosis to treat. You treat where you are needed . So you may get various diagnosis.  You are not assigned a doc patient caseload which can be confusing with communication of needs ect although I'm sure not a big deal. 

I did not get an offer . So take this with a grain of salt . But I will say this i have worked in a hospital system before and felt absolutely welcomed . Go with your gut instinct if you feel like you will be valued as a person and you will get the opportunity to learn and grow as a therapist and not just valued by your work in hours as an employee then by all means take it.
Interview Questions: what's the difference between a r cva and L cva

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Inova in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I got an email from a lady at INOVA's HR for a phone interview on Thursday 3/3/17. I was really excited and looking forward to it. She asked when was a good time for a phone interview. I replied promptly that I was available all day. Nothing heard from her until the end of the day with an apology for replying late. I thanked her for replying any way. She asked me again about the following day. I specified the time at 10 am. She told me she would be in the meeting not able to talk and asked for any other time on that day. I right away gave her all day availability until 5pm. Nothing heard from her again a second time. On Monday the following week, I decided to shoot an email to ask if she was still interested to have a phone interview. She had a quick response with "Yes" and asked when should she call me. This time I also specified the time 3 pm. Nothing heard from her at all again the third time. I waited one more day for her to get back. Nothing at all. I was very anxious and frustrated. I decided to express my disappointment and not pursuing career at this company anymore by email. She replied in the early morning that "we are not interested to interview you any longer."  What is going on with this company? Do you psychologically evaluate people through this process? It was horrible. Your ignorance is considered unacceptable and unprofessional. I've never been treated by any HR like this before. I was contacted  from many places for opportunities. They were all professional. I was so disappointed with this kind of big company. I will never apply for job here for the rest of my life.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Amb Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Inova
Interview Descriptions:
While there are as many different possible interview questions as there are interviewers, it always helps to be ready for anything. Which is why we've taken the time to prepare this list of 100 potential interview questions. 

Will you face them all? We pray no interviewer would be that cruel.

Will you face a few? Probably.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Clinical Technician I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Inova (Fair Oaks, VA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I was first contacted by a recruiter, it took about two day after I turned in the application. They confirmed that you are aware of the time and type of position. Clinical tech is not a walk in the park, you are on your feet and working your whole shift. She confirmed the pay and checked to see if you had another position you were interested in and then told me she would send my resume and application on to the hiring manager. Within a few hours that same day I received a call from the hiring manager who runs the medical unit. She checks to see why you want to work as a clinical tech and why you want to work in their unit. They also make sure you are committing to working at least 1-2 years. Then I scheduled and interview for the very next morning. It was a panel interview with one of the nurse supervisors and the unit secretary as well as the hiring manager. I also got a tour of the unit and talked with a new hire tech who answered all my questions about the job and expectations.

They will hire people with no medical experince, if you desire to pursue nursing or go into medicine it helps your odds a lot. You don't need a degree but again it helps to have some college course under your belt.
Interview Questions:
It's a behavioral interview, you are told to think of specific situations. If you have not worked medical it makes it a little bit harder but lots of jobs have carry over situtions. 
Give a time when you had a difficult patient and how you handled tha situation? 

Give a situation when you had limited resources how did you handle the situation? 

Explain a program/ process you implemented to inmporve your work enviornment? 

Explain a time when you have a coworker who was not doing their job, how did you handle it? 

Explain a time when you had to advocate for a patient? 

Explain your leadership roles.

Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Inova (McLean, VA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions:
If Inova wanted someone ONLY with hospital experience, then why bother calling me at all? Why wasn't that specifically put in the position ad? I felt that INOVA completely wasted my time. With the tests, the phone interviews and the Essay write up I did - I could have put that time into applying for a position with a company that knew who they were looking for. I have 6 years of healthcare IT experience and 15 years overall Marketing experience - I was very clear about my background in the application.

First took two tests in order to complete the application, one was IQ based and one personality based. I have Six years of healthcare IT experience. Two years at VP level. The qualifications did not say that I was required to have hospital experience, but in the healthcare field. The interview with the recruiter was very nice. Then I had a second interview with the hiring manager. She was late, she told me she had 20 minutes for me. It took 20 minutes to go through my resume. Then she asked me to write an email proving that I had healthcare experience that would relate to hospitals. From the get go she put me on the defensive. Why interview me at all if she wanted strictly hospital experience.

I wrote an excellent email about my experience with 6 examples. Two were strategic and two were specific examples of how my experience would relate. I've been a hiring manager in her shoes at this level, this was an excellent example of exactly what she asked for. No response for two and a half weeks and then I get an email saying I didn't get the job because of my lack of hospital expererience and how my experience did not specifically relate.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your background and how it relates to the position at Inova

title: Sterile Processing Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Inova (Leesburg, VA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Took well over a month. Phone interview and then in person interview. Took at least 3 weeks after my offer to get a start date. My interviewer (manager) was late to the interview, which should have given me a tip on how she would end up being as a manager.
Interview Questions: Standard printed out behavior questions.

title: Clinical Technician Interview

Two days later I interviewed with the the clinical director and another two days later I received an offer for the position.

title: Technician Interview

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Inova in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I registered to the BSN Open house that was advertised. Recruitment team later sent an invitation to sign up for a interview time slot before the day. I selected my slot and arrived 45 minutes before my interview to ensure I wouldn't run into any traffic issues or issues finding the location. They asked that you bring two resumes. When I arrived they gave me a folder to put my resumes in and asked me to fill out a small questionnaire on the front of the folder which asked for your experience if any and what are the top two areas you are interested in among a list of 6 areas (Medical, Surgical, Women's Health, Oncology are the ones I could remember). In the waiting area they provided water, coffee, tea, and light refreshments while you wait for an recruiter to call you. Once called they used the auditorium to interview candidates. Throughout the interview they fill you in with what areas have openings and offer to contact a manager to come and interview you if they are available.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had to share difficult medical information with a nurse or physician.

title: Clinical Technician Interview

Interview Descriptions: It was a very easygoing interview. The interviewer read off a list of questions & took notes. The interviewer was friendly. Hospital environment and employees were also friendly and helpful.

title: New Grad RN Interview

title: Clinical Technician Interview

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Inova (Falls Church, VA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Short and to the point, very laid back, managers were very friendly and open to questions I had. Made the atmosphere seem very welcoming, they were both funny. Dressed professionally, but probably could have just worn scrubs.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you had to tell a patient no to a request.

title: Accounts Receivable Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Inova
Interview Descriptions:
Inova has developed a very standardized way hiring and interviewing. However, my Director did not want to adhere to the new and standardized process which I found to be very irritating. She always said "this is my ship and I will run it the way I want to"... anyway, the process was to do a phone screening first and then bring the candidate in for an interview.

As an AR Supervisor, we look for AR Reps to fill the open roles in the department. So, you would typically expect to only meet with one or two people to interview you... Well, not with Inova. They like to have every freaking PFS Supervisor be involved in the interview process. You'd think we are interviewing for the next president. So, the candidate comes in and meets with a panel of supervisors who ask all behavioral based questions in addition to some AR skill set questions.

Then, after you leave we talk about you and decide if you are worth pursuing. We use a scorecard to evaluate how you answered the behavioral based questions and give it to our Director. At that point, it's up to her how she wants to proceed. The process can be long and daunting.
Interview Questions: Explain a time when you had multiple competing priorities. How did you handle it?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Inova (Fairfax, VA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough and personalized. The HR representatives were very polite, well-informed, and able to answer many of many questions. All of the idndividuals who worked with me were incredibly helpful, positive, and created a very hospitable environment of excellence.

title: Registered Nurse Interview

Interview Descriptions: This depraved bureaucratic hospital takes weeks to months to hire.  If you do not make personal contact with the unit manager it make take over a month to secure an interview. The HR department does not freely communicate with managers regarding new applicants.
Interview Questions: What is the most difficult situation you have been in and how was it resolved?

title: RN Interview

title: IT Analyst Interview

Interview Descriptions: The interview process is very thorough.  The initial contact will be for a brief phone interview.  You start with meeting your potential new supervisor on a 1:1 interview.  It all goes well, then you will be contacted to have a second interview with the department manager or director.  The third interview is a panel/group interview with select members of the team you will be working with.  The entire process took almost 2 months.
Interview Questions: You will be asked about your interest in the company.  It is best to be prepared to be familiar with the organization and show interest in what they do.  Be prepared to have examples of Analytic experience.  The job revolves heavily on Analysis and you need to show that you can do that type of work.

title: Administrative Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Inova (Falls Church, VA) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very easy going.  Asked about prior experience and if multi-tasking comes naturally.
Interview Questions: Ask about strengths and weaknesses.

title: Certified Clinical Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Inova (Annandale, VA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: HR calls you to setup interview with manager of applied site. Interview with manager, filled outelectronic paper work, do blood work, background check etc. then start work as long as everything goes well
Interview Questions: Do you have ortho experience and do you have a sense of humor

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Inova (Fairfax, VA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions:
You interview with a couple of program managers to see which program They think you are a fit for not the program you want.
They ask you the typical questions about your experience in jobs where you have had an issue and how you fixed it, what are your strengths and weaknesses.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Department Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Inova (Fairfax, VA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Initial contact from Human Resources that entailed questions regarding experience and desired salary. Inova pays on a scale that is not negotiable. Years of experience and position dictate compensation.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Inova (Falls Church, VA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Started with a phone interview with the hiring manager.  Inova flew me in to interview in person with the hiring manager.  Decision was made the day of the in-person interview.  HR called to let me know and set up my orientation within an hour of the interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to leave your current position?

title: Clinical Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Inova (Arlington, VA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: starts with a brief phone interview with an HR manager, they set up an in person interview.  you meet with the unit manager for 20-30 minutes, it is a behavioral interview.  a lot of if this happened how would you respond, etc. after that you meet with 2 to 3 current employees for a peer interview which is also fairly quick.
Interview Questions: describe a time you failed a patient in your role as a health care provider and what did you learn?

title: Clinical Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Inova (Fairfax, VA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Simple and to the point
Strengths/weaknesses
Why i wanted to work there
Background and experience

I was introduced to the director and she explained the logistics of the job and asked me specific questions. I was offered the job the next day and loved it!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Inova (Falls Church, VA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions:
1. Phone interview 
2. Interview w recruiter
3. Interview w hiring manager

Why do u want to work with epic?
Interview Questions: Why do u want to work w epic?

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Inova in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Normal process for most hospitals
Interview Questions: How will you improve HCAPS?

title: Telecommunications Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Inova in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: They just asked me of my background and my interest in healthcare.. Also questions to determine if I am social, friendly.. am I competent to answer hospital related calls in a professional manner.
Interview Questions: Do you have any foreign language skills?

title: Surgical Tech II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Inova (Fairfax, VA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, traveled for a 1:1 interview with HR and the OR Educator, received an offer maybe two days later. wasn't able to start until Inova offered a hospital wide three day orientation to anyone hired in that time [approximately a month and a half after the initial interview]
Interview Questions: N/A

title: IT Voice Lead Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Inova in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was referred to the position by a friend. I submitted my resume and application on line a few weeks later I received a call from an HR rep. Following the interview I was given an offer and I started training about a month later.
Interview Questions: N/A I interview pretty well. But you may want to read the job description and make sure you fully understand everything that the position will require.

title: Mental Health Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Inova (Falls Church, VA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: initial phone interview with a recruiter where they just set up a time for you to come in to meet with management.  when you come in for the initial interview you meet with two managers for about 20 to 30 minutes and then have a peer interview with 2 to 3 current employees.  a few days after that you will receive a phone call regarding whether or not you got the job
Interview Questions: how would you handle an unruly patient

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Inova in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Easy - Met with Boss , she asked me a few questions about my past jobs, asked me about what I'm doing to further my education and career. After I took tour of the unit , met with potential coworkers - found out I got the job a week later!
Interview Questions: Few questions - past work history and work ethic (Less than 5 minutes)

title: Patient Financial Services Representative III Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Inova (Falls Church, VA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was first called by HR and scheduled face to face with hiring manager. Met hiring manager and interview went very well. After 4 weeks I was called by the Director and 2 weeks after that I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: Tell me something about yourself

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Inova (Fairfax, VA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was good.  Recruiter was very good in following up and scheduling additional interviews.  Process was thorough and organized.  Interview process included initial telephone interview with recruiter and hiring manager, followed by face-to-face interview with manager and panel interview of three.  The information regarding next steps was very good and helpful, again due to the excellent recruiter assigned to the position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you were not successful in building rapport with a colleague.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Inova (Fairfax, VA) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Too long, convoluted and very difficult to get thru to HR. Lots of good applicants never make it past the gate keeping of HR because HR doesn't know how to screen for RN positions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Inova?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Inova (Arlington, VA) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process once you get the interview is OK but the recruiting process is horrible. They never get back to you, take forever to set up the interview, they are very disorganized
Interview Questions: What would you do if you have a difficult physician to deal with.

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Inova (Leesburg, VA) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was very direct, brief, and informative. They asked me multiple questions regarding why I wanted to work there and they were very descriptive on what I had to do.
Interview Questions: They asked me why I wanted to be there. I said I wanted to be there to improve my resume and to gain experience working in a hospital.

title: Occupational Therapist - PRN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Inova in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, and received a call from HR fairly quickly.  Set up an in person interview within two weeks.  Initial interview was with an HR rep, very personable, and gave overview of organization, and potential hiring process.   PRN position was without benefits, which is customary, so no discussion.   Then escorted to hiring manager interview, which was focused on my skills as an OT, along with a brief tour of the facility.
Interview Questions: What is one of your key strengths as an OT?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Inova in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview process went well. The practice manager asked pretty general questions such as, "where do you see yourself in 5 years?" "Where do you see yourself in 10 years?" It was very brief, but she made it comfortable
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Physician Extender Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Inova (Falls Church, VA) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: Met with supervising physician, submitted a plan of ideas to implement, received a phone call with an offer from HR with a low ball offer.
Interview Questions: Asked how I would handle different clinical situations.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Inova (Falls Church, VA) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by a couple people from the team and then brought back to meet the rest of the team on a second day. The interview process was a pleasant experience, but I have very good interviewing skills. I have heard of some teams asking candidates to shadow prior to being offered the job. I think that is a total waste of time, and don't know why they do it.
Interview Questions: Basic generic interview questions and some technical questions related to the job.

title: RN II In the NICU At CNMC Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Inova (Fairfax, VA) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions:
Application online
They called the next day.
Interviewed within a couple weeks.
Job offered to me.
Offer letter received in the mail with salary specifications and benefits.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Inova (Falls Church, VA) in May 2008
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application online. About 3 days later I received a call from a recruiter requesting that I interview with the departments director. During interview the director was very cordial and basically used behavior based interview questions. I was offered the job immediately and was advised that HR would contact me with additional requirements. The following day I was contacted by HR to respond to Telstar Court for a personality profile test. The following day I was, again, contacted by HR to report for New Employee Orientation. The entire process took about two weeks.
Interview Questions: Describe for me; (1) a difficult employee performance deficiency that you have had to handle, (2) how you handled it, (3) was there a positive outcome?
